record_data.record_plain_text: II AVAILABLE AND CHARACTER OF SERVICE A. On and after the effective date of this Tariff, PSEG Power CT may (i) sell capacity and/or energy in varying amounts, at varying levels of firmness or priorities of service, for varying periods of service, and in accordance with varying delivery schedules. All transactions under this Tariff shall be voluntary and subject to the availability of generating or transmission capacity and/or energy to complete the transaction. B. Unless otherwise agreed to in writing by the Parties, it shall be the responsibility of the Eligible Customer to make any and all necessary arrangements for delivery of capacity and/or energy and to request any necessary transmission and/or ancillary service. If the Parties agree that PSEG Power CT shall obtain such transmission service, service under this Tariff is contingent upon PSEG Power CT???s ability to do so, and any such service will be subject to the terms and conditions of all applicable transmission tariffs.
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing re PSEG Power Connecticut LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: III. RATES, TERMS AND CONDITIONS A. All sales of capacity and/or energy shall be made at rates established by agreement between PSEG Power CT and an Eligible Customer. B [RESERVED] C. [RESERVED]. D. [RESERVED] E. Within thirty (30) days after the end of a quarter, PSEG Power CT shall file with the Commission a summary of all its sales and purchases in the prior quarter. The quarterly reports will separately state prices for wholesale generation and ancillary services. F. This Tariff may be amended or terminated by PSEG Power CT pursuant to a unilateral filing in accordance with Section 205 of the Federal Power Act. Termination of this Tariff shall not cause the termination of any specific transaction. G. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. a. PSEG Power CT???s market-based , rate authority is not subject to any limitations. b. Exceptions granted in Wisvest Connecticut, L.L.C., 86 FERC ?? 61,133 (1999) and Wisvest Corporation, et al., 101 FERC ?? 61,166 (2002) Order Paragraph (H): (i) Blanket approval under Section 204 of the FPA and Part 34 of the Commission???s regulations on future issuances of securities and liabilities. (ii) Waiver of Parts 41, 101 and 141 of the Commission's regulations regarding adjustment and certification of accounts and reports and the filing of certain statements reports. (iii) Waiver of subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission???s regulations, requiring the filing of cost-of-service information except for Sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16. H. This Tariff shall become effective on the date accepted by FERC. I. Compliance with Commission Regulations. Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning seller's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the seller???s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning seller???s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff. J. Seller Category. Seller is a Category 2 seller in the Northeast region and a Category 1 seller in the Central, Southwest Power Pool, Southeast, Southwest and Northwest regions, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 5 35.36(a).

record_data.record_plain_text: I. DEFINITIONS The following words and terms used herein shall be understood to have the following meanings: A. Commission or FERC: ???Commission??? or ???FERC??? means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or such successor federal regulatory agency as may have jurisdiction over this Tariff as outlined below. B. Eligible Customer: ???Eligible Customer??? means any entity, including an electric utility, rural electric cooperative or municipal power authority or agency other than a franchised public utility affiliate of PSEG Power CT, that is eligible to take transmission service under an open access transmission tariff on file with FERC. C. Tariff: ???Tariff??? means this market rate power sale tariff, as it may be amended from time to time. D. Parties: ???Parties??? means PSEG Power CT and the Eligible Customer that entered into an agreement for service pursuant to this Tariff.

record_data.record_plain_text: ARTICLE II. CREDITWORTHINESS. 2.1 Financial Information: Prior to the execution or during the term of this Service Agreement or any Transaction Memorandum, PSEG Power CT may require the Purchaser to provide financial information necessary to establish the Purchaser's creditworthiness, including the following information: (a) current financial statements, annual reports, and other publicly available reports and filings; (b) bank references and trade references; and (c) verification of the Purchaser's solvency. 2.2 Payment Guarantees: In addition to providing financial information pursuant to Section 2.1, PSEG Power CT may require the Purchaser to provide and maintain in effect during the term of this Service Agreement such security that PSEG Power CT reasonably may deem necessary to protect PSEG Power CT against the risk of non-payment, which may include an unconditional and irrevocable letter of credit, a deposit, or such alternative form of security proposed by the Purchaser and acceptable to PSEG Power CT, in PSEG Power CT???s sole discretion, consistent with commercial practices established by the Uniform Commercial Code.
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing re PSEG Power Connecticut LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: ARTICLE I. SERVICE AGREEMENT 1.1 Transactions Voluntary: Upon execution of this Service Agreement, PSEG Power CT may enter into transactions with the Purchaser, from time to time to sell capacity, energy, and/or ancillary services as authorized by PSEG Power CT???s Tariffs, upon such terms and conditions and in such quantities as PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser may agree. PSEG Power CT shall have the sole discretion to sell capacity, energy, or ancillary services and PSEG Power CT shall have no obligation under this Service Agreement to construct or modify any facilities in order to provide capacity, energy, or ancillary services hereunder. Neither PSEG Power CT, nor the Purchaser, shall be obligated to enter into any particular transaction, except as the Parties may agree upon on a transaction-specific basis. 1.2 Terms and Conditions for Transactions: The terms and conditions for each transaction entered into under this Service Agreement shall be as negotiated by the Parties and set forth in a memorandum in the form attached to this Service Agreement as Exhibit A (???Transaction Memorandum???). Those terms and conditions shall include, at a minimum, (i) the time period of the transaction, (ii) the price agreed upon for the services to be provided by PSEG Power CT, (iii) the receipt and delivery point(s), (iv) the contract quantity, (v) the degree of firmness of the service, (vi) responsibility for arranging transmission service and any related ancillary services, (vii) responsibilities for any tax liabilities, and (viii) any other transaction- specific terms that may be agreed upon by the Parties. Transaction Memoranda may be delivered to PSEG Power CT by mail, facsimile, or such other means as may be agreed upon by the Parties. 1.3 Cancellation: (a) Service Agreement: This Service Agreement shall be subject to cancellation by either Party upon 60-days prior written notice, provided that such termination will not become effective until the completion of any transactions previously agreed to pursuant to a Transaction Memorandum. (b) Transaction Memoranda: Either Party shall have the right to cancel service agreed to under a Transaction Memorandum upon 30 days prior written notice; provided that such cancellation shall not be effective prior to the completion of any on-going transaction. 1.4 Bankruptcy and Insolvency: PSEG Power CT shall not be required to execute this Service Agreement or to continue a transaction under a Transaction Memorandum if: (a) the Purchaser files a voluntary petition, or has an involuntary petition filed against it, for bankruptcy under the United States Bankruptcy Code, 11 U.S.C. ?? 101 et seq., or similar State insolvency laws; (b) the Purchaser otherwise becomes insolvent and fails to meet its payment obligations when due; or (c) upon review of the financial data in Section 2.1 or other similar data, PSEG Power CT reasonably determines that the Purchaser is not creditworthy, provided that PSEG Power CT may continue to provide capacity, energy or ancillary services if the Purchase prepays for such service or furnishes reasonably security to assure payment for such service.
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing re PSEG Power Connecticut LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text:
ARTICLE IV. GENERAL PROVISIONS. 4.1 Regulation: The provision of the service by PSEG Power CT under this Service Agreement and any Transaction Memorandum agreed to pursuant hereto is subject to the jurisdiction of FERC. Nothing contained in this Service Agreement or any Transaction Memorandum shall be construed as affecting or limiting in any way the right of PSEG Power CT unilaterally to file with FERC, or make application to FERC, for changes to this Service Agreement or to the Tariffs; provided that such changes shall not amend the terms and conditions of any transaction for which PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser have executed a Transaction Memorandum. 4.2 Effective Date: This Service Agreement shall become effective on the date specified in any order of FERC accepting this Service Agreement for filing. PSEG Power CT reserves the right to terminate this Service Agreement if it determines, in its sole discretion, that FERC or any court has imposed any adverse condition, limitation, or qualification on this Service Agreement, or the service or transactions contemplated hereby. 4.3 Representations and Warranties: Each Party warrants that is has the corporate power and/or legal authority to execute, deliver and perform all the terms and provisions of this Service Agreement. Each Party further represents that the individuals executing this Service Agreement on its respective behalf have been duly authorized to do so and that such execution creates a valid, binding and legally enforceable obligation of each party. 4.4 Assignments: This Service Agreement shall be binding upon the Parties thereto, and their successors and assigns. This Service Agreement may not be assigned by the Purchaser, in whole or in part, to any third party without the prior written consent of PSEG Power CT, which consent shall not be unreasonably be withheld. 4.5 Binding Effect: The terms and provisions of this Service Agreement and the respective rights and obligations hereunder of each Party shall be binding upon and insure to the benefit of its successors and assigns, including the creditworthiness and payment guarantee provisions of Article II. In the event the Purchaser assigns or resells to another customer any portion of the capacity, energy or ancillary services purchased hereunder, the Purchaser remains liable to PSEG Power CT for payment of the full amount of such assigned or resold capacity, energy or ancillary services. 4.6 Notices: Written notices required by this Service Agreement shall be deemed properly sent if delivered in person or sent by facsimile, registered or certified mail, or by overnight courier service postage prepaid, to the person specified below: (a) If to PSEG Power CT: ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ (b) If to Purchaser: ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ Any name and/or address hereunder may be changed by written notice by one Party to the other without malting a filing at FERC. 4.7 Liability and Indemnification: Neither PSEG Power CT nor the Purchaser shall be responsible to each other in tort (including negligence or strict liability), or otherwise for any loss, cost or damage of any kind, which may result from performance or non-performance of obligations under this Service Agreement, except for losses, costs, or damages resulting from gross negligence or willful misconduct; provided further that in no event shall PSEG Power CT or the Purchaser be liable to the other Party for incidental, consequential, punitive, special, or indirect damages, which may result from performance or non-performance of obligations under this Service Agreement or any Transaction Memorandum entered into pursuant hereto. The Purchaser expressly agrees to indemnify, hold harmless and defend PSEG Power CT against all claims, liability, costs, attorney or expert witness fees, recoveries, court costs, and all other obligations to third parties, or expense for loss, damage, injury, or death to persons or property in any manner directly or indirectly connected with or growing out of, the performance, actions, or inactions of PSEG Power CT pursuant to this Service Agreement or any Transaction Memorandum entered into pursuant hereto on behalf of the Purchaser, except insofar as such liabilities arise because of gross negligence or willful misconduct of PSEG Power CT. Nothing herein shall create, or be interpreted as creating, any standard of care with reference to, or any duty or liability to any person not a Purchaser hereunder. 4.8 Force Majeure: In the event that either PSEG Power CT or the Purchaser is delayed in or prevented from performing or carrying out its obligations under this Service Agreement or any Transaction Memorandum entered into pursuant hereto, in whole or in part, by reason of Force Majeure, such Party shall not be liable to the other Party for, or on account of, any loss, damage, injury or expense resulting from or arising out of such delay or prevention. As used herein, ???Force Majeure??? means any cause beyond the reasonable control of the Party claiming Force Majeure, including, but without limitation as to the nature or kinds of event, sabotage, strikes, lockouts or other labor disputes, riots, disorders or civil disturbances, vandalism, acts of God, acts of the public enemy, droughts, epidemics, earthquakes, floods, explosions, fires, storms, snow, hail, ice, lightning, wind, landslides, washouts, embargoes, acts of military authorities, actions or inactions of local, State or Federal legislative, judicial, or regulatory agencies, or other lawful authorities, arrests, restraints, transmission system outages or constraints, inability to obtain or failure of equipment, and transportation delays. The Party encountering such delay or prevention shall notify the other Party as soon as reasonably possible of the delay or prevention and shall use due diligence to remove promptly the cause or causes thereof. In order to be relieved of obligations pursuant to this Section 4.8, neither PSEG Power CT nor the Purchaser shall be obligated to settle any strike, walkout, lockout, or other labor dispute on terms which, in the sole judgment of the Party involved in the dispute, are contrary to its interest. Force Majeure shall not excuse the payment of money owed. 4.9 Choice of Law: This Service Agreement and all transactions hereunder shall be governed by, interpreted and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Connecticut. 4.10 Non-Waiver of Defaults: The failure of either Party to enforce at any time any of the provisions of this Service Agreement or to require performance of any of the provisions hereof shall not be construed as a waiver of such provisions nor affect the validity of this Service Agreement or any part hereof or affect the right of such Party thereafter to enforce each and every such provision. 4.11 Severability: If any portion of this Service Agreement is declared invalid or unenforceable by any regulatory body or court of competent jurisdiction by final and non- appealable order, the remaining provisions of this Service Agreement shall not be affected and shall remain in full force and effect. In such event, the Parties shall promptly renegotiate to restore this Service Agreement as nearly as possible to its original intent and effect. 4.12 Headings Not to Affect Meaning: The descriptive headings of the various sections of this Service Agreement are inserted for convenience only and shall not restrict or modify the terms and provisions hereof. 4.13 Survival: Any provision of this Service Agreement that expressly or by implication comes into or remains in force following the termination of this Service Agreement shall survive such termination including, but not limited to, fulfillment of payment obligations for services rendered pursuant to this Service Agreement. 4.14 Confidentiality: PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser shall treat as confidential all prices and terms and conditions of any proposed or actual transaction hereunder (???Confidential Matter???). Confidential Matter shall be for the sole and exclusive use of PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser and, subject to the provisions set forth below, neither PSEG Power CT nor the Purchaser shall publish, disclose, or otherwise divulge the Confidential Matter to any person at any time without the prior written consent of the other Party unless the release of Confidential Matter is pursuant to a requirement imposed by FERC or any other governmental or judicial body of competent jurisdiction. When either PSEG Power CT or the Purchaser receives from any other entity or person a request for Confidential Matter not then in the public domain, it shall inform the other of such request as soon as reasonably practicable. PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser shall reasonably cooperate with each other in the exercise of any applicable lights to oppose the disclosure of the Confidential Matter to the requestor or to prevent the Confidential Matter from becoming a part of the public domain. Confidential Matter need not be treated confidentially once it has passed into the public domain. PSEG Power CT retains the right to submit aggregated transaction information as required by FERC, including, but not limited to, information contained in quarterly transaction summaries which PSEG Power CT is required to file with FERC. 4.15 Relationship with the Parties: Any undertaking or commitment by one Party to the other under any provisions of the Tariffs, this Service Agreement, or any Transaction Memorandum, shall not constitute the dedication of facilities or any portion thereof of any Party to the other Party or to the public. Nothing herein shall be construed to create an association, joint venture, partnership, or other type of entity or relationship between PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser, or between either or both of them with any other party. IN WITNESS WHEREOF, the Parties have caused this Service Agreement to be signed and sealed as of the day and year first above written by their duly authorized representatives. PSEG Power Connecticut LLC.

record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing re PSEG Power Connecticut LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: ARTICLE III. BILLING AND PAYMENTS. 3.1 Submission of Payment: Bills for amounts due to PSEG Power CT hereunder rendered shall be submitted, and payments shall be due, under terns to be specified by the Parties. (a) All bills rendered by PSEG Power CT shall be sent to: ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ (b) All payments by Purchaser shall be wire transferred to: ________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________ 3.2 Off-sets: Each Pasty may set-off any amounts owed to the other Party against any amount owed by the other Pasty pursuant to this Service Agreement or other arrangements agreed to between the Parties. 3.3 Interest: Interest on unpaid amounts or payments received after the due date shall accrue at d rate equal to the prime commercial lending rate established from time to time by Citibank N.A., New York, New York, or its successor (or such other lending institution as may be agreed to by the Parties), from the due date until the date upon which payment is made. 3.4 Billing Disputes: A Purchaser may in good faith challenge the correctness of any bill rendered under this Service Agreement, provided that such challenge is brought within twelve (12) months after the date the bill was rendered, Any billing challenge shall be in writing and shall state the specific basis for the challenge. In the event that the Purchaser challenges any portion of a bill, the Purchaser shall, despite the challenge, pay a both the disputed and the undisputed portions of the bill on or before the due date agreed to pursuant to Section 3.1. Billing adjustments will be made pursuant to Section 3.5 of this Service Agreement. 3.5 Billing Adjustments: PSEG Power CT may adjust any bill rendered under this Service Agreement, provided that such adjustment is made within twelve (12) months after the date the bill was rendered. Any billing adjustment shall be in writing and shall state the specific basis for the adjustment.
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing re PSEG Power Connecticut LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: II. AVAILABILITY AND CHARACTER OF SERVICE A. On and after the effective date of this Ancillary Services Tariff, PSEG Power CT may sell Ancillary Services as follows: (1) New England: Seller offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc. (2) Third Party Provider Sales. Seller offers Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers.
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing re PSEG Power Connecticut LLC Market-Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: I. DEFINITIONS The following words and terms used herein shall be understood to have the following meanings: A. Ancillary Services: ???Ancillary Services??? means, without limitation, operating reserve ??? spinning reserve service and operating reserve ??? supplemental reserve service (including 10-minute spinning reserves, 10-minute non-spinning reserves, and 30-minute reserves), regulation and frequency response service reactive supply and voltage control for generation service, and energy imbalance service, as well as such other services as may be recognized from time to time by FERC as Ancillary Services. B. Commission or FERC: ???Commission??? or ???FERC??? means the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission or such successor federal regulatory agency as may have jurisdiction over this Tariff as outlined below. C. Eligible Customer: Eligible Customer??? means any entity, including an electric utility, rural electric cooperative or municipal power authority or agency other than a franchised public utility affiliate of PSEG Power CT, that is eligible to take transmission service under an open access transmission tariff on file with FERC. D. Ancillary Services Tariff: ???Ancillary Services Tariff??? means this tariff for the sale of ancillary services at market rates, as it may be amended from time to time. E. Parties: ???Parties??? means PSEG Power CT and the Eligible Customer that entered into an agreement for service pursuant to this Ancillary Services Tariff.

WHEREAS, PSEG Power CT has on file with the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (???FERC???) market-based rate tariffs designated as Rate Schedule FERC Nos. 1 and 1-A, as they may be amended from time to time, under which PSEG Power CT may make wholesale sales of electric energy, capacity and/or ancillary services at negotiated rates and terms (???Tariffs???); and WHEREAS, PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser have agreed to enter into this Service Agreement to enable PSEG Power CT to make sales, and the Purchaser to make purchases, of electric energy, capacity, and/or ancillary services under the Tariffs at rates and terms to which PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser may agree; NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual agreements, covenants and conditions herein contained, PSEG Power CT and the Purchaser do hereby agree as follows:

record_data.record_plain_text:
III. RATES, TERMS AND CONDITIONS A. All sales of Ancillary Services shall be made at rates established by mutual agreement between PSEG Power CT and an Eligible Customer and are subject to the availability of generating or transmission capacity and/or energy to complete the transaction. B. Within thirty (30) days after the end of a quarter, PSEG Power CT shall file with the Commission a summary of all its sales and purchases of ancillary services in the prior quarter. C. This Ancillary Services Tariff may be amended or terminated by PSEG Power CT pursuant to a unilateral filing in accordance with Section 205 of the Federal Power Act. Termination of this Ancillary Services Tariff shall not cause the termination of any specific transaction. D. This Ancillary Services Tariff shall become effective on the date accepted by FERC. E. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. a. PSEG Power CT???s market-based rate authority is not subject to any limitations. b. Exceptions granted in Wisvest Connecticut, L.L.C., 86 FERC ?? 61,133 (1999) and Wisvest Corporation, et al., 101 FERC ?? 61,166 (2002) Order Paragraph (H): (i) Blanket approval under Section 204 of the FPA and Part 34 of the Commission???s regulations on future issuances of securities and liabilities. (ii) Waiver of Parts 41, 101 and 141 of the Commission???s regulations regarding adjustment and certification of accounts and reports and the filing of certain statements reports. (iii) Waiver of subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission???s regulations, requiring the filing of cost-of-service information except for Sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16. c. Exemptions granted in Public Service Electric and Gas Company, et al., 134 FERC ?? 61,138 (2011): (i) Waiver of the affiliate restrictions codified in the Commission???s regulations at 18 C.F.R. ?? 35.39.
F. Compliance with Commission Regulations. Seller shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Seller???s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes seller to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits the seller???s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning seller???s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Tariff. G. Seller Category. Seller Category. Seller is a Category 2 seller in the Northeast region and a Category 1 seller in the Central, Southwest Power Pool, Southeast, Southwest and Northwest regions, as defined in 18 C.F.R. 5 35.36(a).
record_data.filing_title: Compliance Filing pursuant to February 25, 2011 Order
